result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Skenandore

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:52 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Justin L Skenandore.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. McFadden provides an update; the offer is contingent on his client enrolling in counseling and needs more time to do so.  Atty. McFadden requests another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. F Defendant Justin L Skenandore appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Justin L Skenandore. Atty. McFadden provides an update, he just put in a request for discovery and an offer.  He is requesting a further proceedings date in about 40 days.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty. McFadden requesting his client be allowed to appear by Zoom for the 9/12/2022 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/9/22 - Request approved.**
Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022. Court appoints Attorney McFaddeb/under the Waukesha County Capitation Contract. Signed by Judge Paul F Reilly August 18, 2022. (BC)
Filed by Atty. McFadden.

Filed by the defendant.  Court will grant the petition; Court orders repayment at $100.00/month with the first payment being due 09/01/2022.

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin L Skenandore in court. Court notes the matter is before the Court on status of court appointed attorney.  Defendant advises he has a completed petition with him in court today.  Court will grant the petition; Court orders repayment at $100.00/month with the first payment being due 09/01/2022.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:41 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Justin L Skenandore in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to proceed pro se.  Defendant advises he does not qualify for a public defender, but forgot the paperwork for court appointed attorney.  Court provides the defendant with the petition for court appointed attorney and advises the defendant he can file it with the clerk's office or bring it to his next court date.  Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:24 AM Defendant Justin L Skenandore in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court takes a short recess at 9:26 AM to allow for the State to be in contact with Victim Witness.  Matter recalled at 9:50 AM with the same appearances.  The State further explains the request of Victim A on the record that she would request a no violent contact order.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on May 26th, 2022.
posted at Muskego PD
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
